summary:
Laozi was an ancient Chinese philosopher and the author of the Tao Te Ching, a book that started Taoism. He is often called "the Old Master." Many stories about him are considered legendary. Some say he lived in the 6th century BC, worked for the Zhou court, and met Confucius. He is believed to have written the Tao Te Ching in one night before disappearing.

Laozi is seen as a key figure in Chinese history, and his teachings influenced many other philosophers and religions. However, some modern scholars think the book was written later and by multiple people.
title: Laozi
